TopicTitle: Anyway to change the sensitivity of crashes/collisions?

Articles.Content:
Im having an issue where id stage boosters and the tip of the booster would give the central core tank a "love tap" , then exploding the entire ship. Realistically that would not happen in real life. Id like a way to tone it down a few notches and still allow me to have crashes turned on.

Edited December 9, 2014 by lextacy
answered

Use sepratrons to push your depleted boosters away faster, avoiding contact altogether. You could edit config files to increase impact tolerance, not sure what text, or what chunk of code, you'd search for though.

Actually, yes that absolutely WOULD happen in real life. Both the 'love tap' and the ensuing "rapid unplanned disassembly" (aka 'Gigantic Kaboom'). The only reason is DOESN'T happen (a minor but very important distinction) is because successful space programs expend a great deal of engineering brainpower and computing time to ensure it doesn't. Space Shuttles used Separatrons, essentially. Soyuz has a different method which I don't recall at the moment and am too lazy to go look up, but they do take active measures to make sure the strap-on boosters go 'out and away' rather than 'in and love tap'.
You can also spin to give discarded boosters some momentum away from your ship.
